intro: Persea rigida var. claussenii, commonly known as the Mexican persimmon, is a species native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a small evergreen tree that typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually greenish-yellow in color.
